abstract.p: Nurlan Balgimbaev, president of of Kazakhstan's state oil company Kazakhoil who has been linked to investigation by US federal prosecutors, denies allegations that he took bribes from international oil companies; Balgimbaev was named in US Justice Department document that states that American trade consultant may have passed on bribes from units of major oil companies like Phillips Petroleum, Amoco and Mobil (S)

block.p: The president of Kazakhstan's state oil company, who has been linked to an investigation by United States federal prosecutors, has denied allegations that he took bribes from international oil companies, Russian news agencies reported. Kazakhoil's president, Nurlan Balgimbaev, was named in a United States Justice Department document that states that an American trade consultant may have passed on bribes from units of major oil companies like Phillips Petroleum, Amoco and Mobil. ''I can tell you right now, I am clean -- I guarantee it,'' said Mr. Balgimbaev, speaking in the Kazakh city of Atyrau.
